fields.description:
When importing from bugzilla, if an error occurs importing a bug, instead of killing the whole import process, it should continue with the import.  When the process is complete, the errors should be reported.  

At a minimum, the re-index process always needs to execute.  Otherwise, the JIRA app is left in a wierd state and it is impossible to find some bugs.
fields.summary: Bugzilla Import should try importing all and report errors at end
Please add getIssueLinkManager() method to ComponentManager

fields.description:
On our copy of Jira progress calculation in roadmap is incorrect. A project with 51 issues shows text: "(-1 of 53 issues have been resolved)".

Project issues are divided into
43 unresolved
6 fixed, closed
1 won't fix, closed
1 resolved, fixed
fields.summary: Progress calculation: (-1 of 53 issues have been resolved)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-4451].
  {panel}

Standard response
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 23 April 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your input in the comments helps us understand how this affects you and what you're hoping to accomplish with JIRA.
 
At this time, this suggestion is not on the JIRA development roadmap. While the idea is definitely solid, we're re-evaluating the entire JIRA notifications system, and that may entail new ways to customize emails that don't use velocity templates at all.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].
 
I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.
 
Regards,
Dave Meyer
[dmeyer@atlassian.com|mailto:dmeyer@atlassian.com]
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

It would be very handy if, instead of adding headers like 'Subject' programmatically, JIRA let headers be specified in the email velocity templates.

This would elegantly solve a number of problems, and open new possibilities:

 - Subject could be easily customized (JRA-3568) and i18nized (JRA-4419)
 - We could easily make the Precedence: Bulk header removeable, for users like the ASF where this triggers spam filters
 - The From: address could be customized easily (JRA-2315)
 - Custom headers could be added (JRA-3933, JRA-4440)

If this requires JIRA to parse the text to extract headers, we could read the To:, Cc: and Bcc: headers and append their values to the notification scheme targets.
fields.summary: Make email headers editable in notification templates

fields.description: Occasionally people don't enter an Organization on the signup form, and when such licenses are entered into JIRA, one gets a cryptic "invalid license key" error.  We should either enforce the entry of an organization, or fix the code in JIRA so that these are accepted.
fields.summary: JIRA should not barf on licenses without an organization

fields.description:
We have occasional reports of problems where the statistics (eg. on the Browse Project page) get out of synch with reality.  A reindex usually fixes this, but it would be nice to know the sequence of events that leads to this.

This issue is to collate all reports of this nature, and hopefully identify the sequence of events that corrupts stats/indexes.
fields.summary: Statistics get corrupted

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-4446].
{panel}
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 6 November 2017|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi all,

Thanks for providing your thoughts and votes on this suggestion. I know it's been a while since we last commented on this suggestion and we are sorry to have kept you so long without a clear answer.

We (the Jira Server team) have recently reviewed this suggestion and how it would fit alongside our strategy and other customer priorities. I am afraid we are not planning to invest in more extensive issue hierarchies in Jira. Therefore we decided to close this issue.

While we absolutely understand the logic behind this request, we strongly believe that we should focus on making Jira simpler and easier to use rather then introduce additional complexity on both conceptual and technical level.

Jira as a tool promotes agile approach to project management, where simplicity is key and teams work iteravely to deliver small sections of a project at a time. We strongly believe that current hierarchy of epic, task (story) and subtask supports this approach.

Meanwhile, as Atlassian, we understand that growing teams may require more flexibility. This is why we are investing in [Portfolio for Jira|https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/portfolio/enterprise]. Portfolio extends Jira hierarchy with the concept of initiative and helps organize and prioritize your team's work to build a realistic roadmap that spans multiple teams and Jira projects.

Also there is a commercial third party plugin available, [Structure|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.almworks.jira.structure] that provides the ability to create a hierarchy of issues for Jira Server customers.

Since investing in more extensive issue hierarchies in the Jira platform is not aligned with our strategy and roadmap, we will be closing this issue. I understand that our decision may be disappointing, but we also hope that you will appreciate our candid and transparent approach. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Gosia Kowalska
Senior Product Manager, Jira Server
{panel}
*Original request description:*

As a JIRA user I need more hierarchical organisation of tasks. As of today JIRA offers only a two-level hierarchy (if installed without plugins): stories and subtasks. But in reality the process of resolving issues can be much more complicated. During the process of analysis a simple story can be broken into a number of sub-tasks. And then each of the sub-tasks may be consequently broken into a set of even more granular entities. JIRA does not support an easy way of handling multiple levels of hierarchy in a natural way and the available workarounds require additional steps which render the solution suboptimal.
fields.summary: Sub-issues should be able to contain their own sub-issues

fields.description:
When an issue contains sub-issues, the parent should not be able to be resolved unless all sub-issues are also resolved.

This behaviour should probably be configurable, but it would make sense that sub-issues block the parent.

On a similiar vein, if the parent issue is resolved, then the sub-issues should also be resolved, with the same comment/fix-for details.
fields.summary: Parent issues can be resolved with open sub-issues

fields.description: When an issue is a sub-issue, the RSS/XML description of an item doesn't identify itself as being a sub-issue or which issue is its parent.
fields.summary: XML/RSS for sub-issue doesn't identify parent issue.

fields.description: When an issue contains sub-issues, these issues are not references in the XML/RSS view for an item.
fields.summary: RSS/XML Issue entries don't identify sub-issues

fields.description:
The roadmap and changelog reports don't identify issues as being sub-issues which doesn't convey an accurate view of the project.

Now that issues can contain sub-issues, reports should identify this, and display the hierachy.
fields.summary: Roadmap doesn't indicate issues as being sub-issues
Include issue ID in email headers

fields.description:
The list of 'known issues' for 3.0 preview says:

Issues with custom fields are not moved correctly. 

Which implies that you can move issues but it doesn't always work right. However, I cannot get my instance of jira to move issues at all. No exceptions appear in the server logs. This probably relates to custom fields, but all of my custom fields are cross project, so I was hoping this wouldn't be a problem.

Moving issues is a critical problem for us and functionality which we were confident would be in v3.0.
fields.summary: Move issue doesn't work

fields.summary: Switching workflow scheme breaks:  Unknown workflow name

fields.description: when you initially create a new transition for a workflow you have the opportunity to set the transition view. After you save the transition you cannot alter the view it uses via the workflow editor.
fields.summary: cannot alter transition view after initial transition create

fields.description: The workflow xml files produced by the jira preview workflow editor tag the xml files with the 'workflow_2_8.dtd', which cannot be found on the opensymphony site (and I believe should be workflow_2_7.dtd)
fields.summary: HTTP error: could not GET file '/osworkflow/workflow_2_8.dtd' on server 'www.opensymphony.com'

fields.description: During translation I found several pages with hardcoded strings. See screenshots.
fields.summary: many strings not localized
need "Email on new issue" feature

fields.description:
Creation of new issue results in the following error:
Form Errors: 
Exception: com.opensymphony.workflow.InternalWorkflowException: Could not create workflow entry 

The dtd does not seem to be the probleem (see issue http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-2776), it can be downloaded. 

Any ideas?
fields.summary: InternalWorkflowException: Could not create workflow entry

fields.description: We imported our 2.6.1 data into the 3.0 Enterprise Preview and the linked tasks no longer display. Adding a link manually between two issues in 3.0 also does not appear to create the link. No errors are thrown when the link is created, the link just doesn't show up.
fields.summary: Linked issues information not displayed

fields.description:
Every so often (several times an hour), pages come back from the server either blank, or partially rendered.

When this happens there's no error message in the logs, even with the log level turned up to DEBUG.

Sometimes the pages are completely blank, other times they're half rendered, other times they are completely rendered, except the issue list is empty, even when it says 'display 1-30 of X issues'.

I've searched the open and closed issues, and also the forums, and the only instances I've found of this same issue have always mentioned errors in the logs.

Any ideas about this?

I should note that restarting the resin instance has no effect.
fields.summary: random blank pages, and random empty issue lists

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of Oct 1, 2010|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}

This problem is detected by the JIRA Integrity Checker. If you receive these errors, select {{Fix}} to fix them safely.
{panel}


We have warnings in the console that I cannot understand :

WARN [fields.layout.field.DefaultFieldLayoutManager] Field layout contains non-orderable field with id 'customfield_10021'.

What does it mean ?
What is the consequence of this warning regarding the database or the execution of JIRA ?

We can email you our XML export if you want.
We have defined a specific worflow and specific statuses.
fields.summary: Deleting a custom field doesn't delete its references in field layout schemes

fields.summary: Many Exceptions Thrown When Setting Up Jira

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-4420].
  {panel}

I tested the new workflow editor that is very promising.
But today, it seams to be impossible to complete an edition using the web editor, because the editor does not support editing all the parameters :
- I cannot delete all of the unconditional conditions that I have created
- I cannot modify the arguments of existing unconditional conditions, validators, conditions or functions
- All the function and condition classes are not available via the editor (Updates change history for an issue, Re-indexes an issue, IssueResolveFunction, FilterCurrentStepCondition, etc...)
- I cannot create, edit or delete global transitions
- I cannot create, edit or delete global post functions
- I cannot change the linked status
- I cannot rename or delete a step of the workflow
- I cannot edit the condition type (AND, OR, etc...)
- I don't know what are the possible meta attributes and what they can do
fields.summary: The workflow editor should be much more flexible

fields.description:
JIRA emails are difficult to translate, because:

- text in the email templates must be converted to UTF-8
- parts of the Subject string are hardcoded
- there is only one global set of templates, so the personal language setting does not affect the email language

Suggestions:

- convert text in the templates to UTF-8 or whatever is required, so that emails with international characters can be sent

- put the language ID (default, de_DE etc.) somewhere in the path so that one can have several email template subdirectories or files in the required languages (the templates should ideally live in language_*.jar, but separate directories would be ok too)

- replace all hardcoded text in email processing with accesses to a property file

It is probably not much work but would improve the JIRA look and feel for international customers.
fields.summary: need translated email templates

fields.description:
When viewing the full Content View the Custom Fields are not displayed.
There seems to be a method mismatch (jsps probably not updated to use new custom field code).
fields.summary: Custom Fields don't show in Full Content View

fields.description:
the language_default.jar contains the string

<<<<<<< IssueNavigator.properties

at default/com/atlassian/jira/web/action/issue/IssueNavigator.properties line 72 of 84
fields.summary: garbage in properties file

fields.description: After the extraction of statsbody.vm from filterstats.vm and projectstats.vm, there are no longer links to searches for the list of stat types.
fields.summary: Stats portlets now lack links to relevant searches

fields.description:
(you should have a "reports" component in the JIRA project now that the plugins framework will hopefully mean more reports will be created)

Anyway, the version workload report is a great idea; but it doesn't deal very well with unknown unassigned items. It should add a line for unassigned just the same as any developer. When planning versions, you don't always assign all issues, but you do want to get an overall idea of where in the release you are.
fields.summary: version workload report & unassigned issues

fields.description:
when viewing the time tracking report's excel view, the "original estimate (min)" field displays

$report.getDurationInMinutes($issue.getLong("timeoriginalestimate"))
fields.summary: velocity bug in time tracking report

fields.description: Currently if there is a long summary, it wraps at 50% of the screen width. We should make it extend most of the way in the page.
fields.summary: JIRA issue text should extend over full width of screen

fields.description:
We currently have 7 issues in a particular version, all are marked as "UNRESOVLED" in the detail listing.

The progress bar reports 4 resolved, 3 unresolved.

Two things that may be handy to know:
4 of our issues are new features
3 are improvements

4 of our issues are "major"
3 are "critical"
1 is "minor"
fields.summary: Road Map reports unresolved issues as resolved in progress bar

fields.description:
I know we currently have the ability to archive a version, but i think it would also be good if we could archive a project.

In our JIRA we about about 20 project now.  We create a new project for each client's applications that we develop and we also have one project for our Core Product.  

We have some older projects that really aren't worked on anymore and they are taking up room on the Projects Table and in the project drop downs and such.  It would be nice if we could archive the project so it didnt' display but we dont' want to delete the information.
fields.summary: Archive Project

fields.description: We need the a bulk change option to move issues from one to another project.
fields.summary: Bulk change move issues
Bulk change Move Issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-4399].
  {panel}

We need the ability, to create hyperlinks with whitespaces.

For Example to create a link to a windows directory:
z:\jira\doku 2.6.1\
z:\jira\doku 3.0\
fields.summary: Hyperlink Syntax and Whitespaces

fields.description:
We need to customize the excel export per user. On option to export exactly the columns of the current filter would be very helpful.

PS: We already use the workaround JRA-2967, but this isn't enough.
fields.summary: Customizable Excel Export

fields.description: After adding/deleting a column or changing column order, all sample data disappears and you can't even add a new column.
fields.summary: 'Edit Column Order' screen malfunctioning after first edit operation

fields.description:
When deleting a user, if the user has reported or is assigned an issue, the error page contains text:

Assigned Issues:  	 0
Reported Issues: 	3 

The text should be links to predefined searches for the current user, so the administrator can reassign/change the reporter for the relevant issues.
fields.summary: When deleting a user with issues, link to relevant predefined searches

fields.description:
I included all the strings left and made minor updates to old messages to make them more user-oriented.

I saw there're still a lot of strings that cannot be localized.
fields.summary: updated russian translation for 3.0 Preview

fields.description:
Currently to generate an issue's RSS, we have a whole bunch of if-then logic in issuedetails-rss.jsp iterating through fields and objects of an issue, and rendering them.  All this logic should be written as code in an action, which would construct a DOM object of some sort, and then pass this to the JSP for rendering as text.

This should also eliminate encoding bugs (JRA-3398), as an XML library presumably does a better job ensuring generated text is valid than we do.
fields.summary: Rewrite issue RSS generator as an action

fields.description:
The Java formatting classes (eg java.text.SimpleDateFormat) are not tread safe and instances should not be used as constants (eg MantisImportBean).
Annoying and unlikely to cause big problems, but it's caused issues in production systems before and is worth considering.
fields.summary: Formatting is not thread safe

fields.description: issuedetails-rss.jsp loops over validCustomFields.  issue-rss.jsp includes issuedetails-rss.jsp and then also loops over visibleCustomFields.  It looks like there would then be two sets of custom fields displaying.
fields.summary: Custom fields duplicated in issue RSS

fields.description: MantisImportBean.createChangeHistory writes a single "Mantis Import Key" entry to the Jira Change History, but does not attempt to migrate any of the original Mantis Change History.
fields.summary: Mantis Change History not included in migration

fields.description: Currently the Mantis importer can import attachments from disk, but not attachments stored in the database table.  This needs to be fixed.
fields.summary: Mantis importer should import attachments stored in the database

fields.description: Imports from Excel (comma-separated values) are the most common, yet our CSV importer is still in a rather primitive state, and cannot handle relations like versions and components.  It would be good to have a CSV importer that let the user define a mapping from CSV columns to JIRA fields, and define mappings from CSV values to JIRA values where applicable.
fields.summary: Customizable CSV importer

fields.description:
Attempts to re-index yields this error:

Exception reindexing: com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.IndexException: Error creating GenericValue (SQL Exception while getting value: (SAP DBTech JDBC: null))
fields.summary: Re-Indexing broken on Tomcat 5.0.27

fields.description:
The user can choose between HTML or text emails, but there is no administrator option to choose HTML emails as the default.

It would make sense to choose HTML emails as a default for all intranets where the users have a known working HTML capable email program.
fields.summary: Select HTML email format as global default
flexible date format entry needed

fields.description: After clicking the "Assign to" link the user list contains the entries 'Unassigned' and 'Automatic', which are hardcoded in the source code and therefore can't be translated.
fields.summary: 'Unassigned' and 'Automatic' strings not internationalized

fields.description:
I created a custom field with the name "ÄÖÜ Test". The XML export in the issue navigator now fails because the export seems to contain the string 

<customfieldname>ÄÖÜ Test</customfieldname> 

which is not legal XML.
fields.summary: XML export fails if description of custom field contains umlaut characters

fields.description: The tab 'Version Control' for most, probably all, issues in our Jira gives the following error: "An unknown error occurred - actions == null." At the moment I cannot find an issue that doesn't give this error; but I'm moderately sure that it did work someday.
fields.summary: Version Control says 'actions == null'

fields.description:
1. If one leaves the mouse arrow over the issue type icons and priority icons (probably also resolution icons, did not have umlaut characters in those string) in the issue navigator, umlaut characters in the tool tips are not properly displayed (see screenshot). However displaying the tool tips for the same icons in the project overview displays the correct tooltip string.

2. the tooltip string for the issue navigator column headers is not translated, it reads "sort by (column name)", where column name is the translated column name, but the "sort by" string is not translated.
fields.summary: Localization problem in ToolTips

fields.description: posibility of malicious execution of ambiguos code
fields.summary: NSS vulnerability

fields.description:
The "components" list in the filter displays the "Any" string although the user has selected german language. The versions lists display the translated string though.

I believe the following source code files need to be fixed:

$ grep -r "'Any'"  .
./jira/src/webapp/secure/admin/user/views/userbrowser.jsp:            <ui:param name="'headerrow'" value="'Any'" />
./jira/src/webapp/secure/popups/userpicker.jsp:                         <ui:param name="'headerrow'" value="'Any'" />
./jira/src/webapp/includes/navigator/filter-form/versions.jsp:    <ui:param name="'headerrow'" value="'Any'" />
fields.summary: 'Any' string not internationalized

fields.description:
The user has selected the german language setting, but column headers in the excel report are still in english. Try the link below (german language is default), then click on "Excel".

Also, the umlaut characters in the string "Vorgänge 1 bis 20 von 58 Vorgängen insgesamt" are not displayed properly. Umlaut characters in the issue summaries are correct though.

http://www.softwaretesting.de/jira-demo/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&pid=10000&statusIds=1
fields.summary: Excel report column headers not translated

fields.description: The current version does support jdbc
fields.summary: Support JDBC

fields.description:
Project summary on the project screen displays stats only for built-in Open, In Progress and Reopened states.

I use a bit longer workflow which involves testers(backend) and QA (frontend) where issue's states are: Open->In progress->Resolved->Verified->Tested->Closed.

It would be nice to setup project or states so That it will display statistics on issues in my custom states e.g.:
Project summary
  Open  12
  In progress 4
  Reopened 2
  Resolved 20
  Verified 10
  Tested 12.

The same applies to "Open issues" panel under Project summary.
fields.summary: Project summary is limited to certain states

fields.description: If I use russian characters in worflow name or its description JIRA displays new workflow with blank name and description. "Del" command is not available. See screenshot attached.
fields.summary: Cannot use extended character set in workflow name and description

fields.description: Resin 2.1.8 ships with its own XML parser, which does not check for non-unicode characters in the output, and can thus generate invalid XML.   When JIRA is run inside Resin, it can therefore generate invalid XML exports that the importer cannot parse.
fields.summary: JIRA can generate invalid XML backups when run under Resin

fields.description:

fields.description:
Hi there,

I am a Tester for SolutionsIQ in Bellevue, WA.

As I was entering a bug today, I found the following problem: I typed a URL into the description field of the bug as  
http://t-iis01/SolutionMaps/Administration/default.aspx?<script>
As you can see below, it changed the first < to < - it left the  
closing bracket. 

http://t-iis01/SolutionMaps/Administration/default.aspx?<script>

This can be annoying in the way that I wanted to specifically show  
<script>. With opening and closing tag. When our developers repro this bug, they will write ?<script>  instead of <script>.

Now I have to write a comment explaining that I didn't mean to type
< but the actual opening bracket.
Can you please put this as a thing to fix for a future version?

Thanks,
Chris

Christina Hesse
Lead Software Test Engineer
SolutionsIQ - Professional Services
425.451.2727 x 2440
chesse@solutionsiq.com

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-4329].
  {panel}

Running out of memory is a common cause of problems amongst JIRA users.  It can have unpredictable effects, leaving memory structures in inconsistent states, and generally cause weird errors that are a PITA for the poor schmo doing support to debug.

The JavaSpecialists guy wrote an article about how low memory conditions can be detected in JDK1.5:

http://www.javaspecialists.co.za/archive/Issue092.html

We should investigate if we can write a Johnson filter that detects this condition, logs a warning, and perhaps adds a warning to the ticker at the top, visible to administrators
fields.summary: Investigate creating an OutOfMemory warning system

fields.description:
(description from JRA-5229)

We have a very large user base (thousands of users).

It would be good if a group could contain a reference to other groups since this makes maintaining groups much less tedious.

For example:

Group A: User1, User2

Group B: User65, User 98

Group C: Group A, Group B, User 142

Group C is in a sense "dyanmic" so that if another user is added to Group A then Group C is effectively updated too (i.e. I'm not request the ability to have a "one time copy" of users into a new group).


From a mail thread on jira-users

> A useful feature, I think.  I'm trying to enforce some sort of consistency
> in permissioning projects by using groups like $(key)-admin,
> $(key)-developer, $(key)-submitter.  When only a small subset of people
> are allowed to submit a ticket, this works fine but when a project wants
> 'everyone' to be able to submit then I wind up not creating the -submitter
> group and permissioning jira-users instead.  I'd like to be able to still
> create and permission the $(key)-submitter group for consistency but just
> make 'jira-users' a member... consistency in the groups makes scripting a
> lot easier too...
fields.summary: Nesting groups within groups

fields.description:
I'd like to see a custom field of type 'user' that is a drop-down of the currently active users (maybe this could be filtered by group so that the list doesn't get too long?).

When we assign tasks, we also assign a person as the designated design partner and code reviewer.  The easiest way to do this in Jira at the moment is to either manually create a list (alas, there must be a default for it) or to use a text field.  It would be preferrable for our process to have a process whereby you could assign from a drop-down for this list.

I'm not sure yet how the workflow is setup, but it would be nice as well if there were some way to customize the workflow to assign to the reviewer after the developer has completed their work.
fields.summary: Create a custom field of type 'User'
Allow custom fields of the same type used by the built-in Timetracking

fields.description:
Some pages in JIRA 3.0 are starting to exhibit problems under Internet Explorer due to Internet Explorers botched understanding of the CSS Box Model.  (See screenshot for example).

I would recommend including a doctype on all pages within JIRA.  Choose one that switches on "Standards Compliant Mode" for Internet Explorer: ->

http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/default.asp?url=/library/en-us/dnie60/html/cssenhancements.asp

By making this switch, Internet Explorer should behave more along the lines of Mozilla/Netscape/Opera/KDE/Safari.

Note: after making this switch, - other layout issues may become apparent (such as center/left alignment).  (There will likely be a raft of other small issues come up).
fields.summary: css box model internet explorer - broken (needs compensation)
